Pair Programming and the Roles of Driver and Navigator

CJ Wilson and Chris Bohl

Contact Us:Chris Bohl CJ Wilson

What is Pair Programming?

Pair programming is a social way to code that allows two people to check each other as they code.

Why is Pair Programming Important to DevBootcamp?

Pair programming is a great way to develop programmers who are able to do more than just code--DBC graduates can interact and collaborate with others, and in a team environment, this skill is vital. Pairing is also an efficient way to learn.

What is the Difference Between Driver and Navigator?

The driver is the person at the keyboard who deals with typing the syntax of the program. The navigator directs the driver and suggests what to code.
